intro: Anneslia tetraphylla, commonly known as the four-leafed anneslia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Anneslia tetraphylla is known for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance.
